title: Strip Scribbles: Lakers vs. Kings, Pete Rose Bar & Grill, ‘Sexxy,’ Britney Spears
text:
Launch slideshow » 
It’s a battle between baseball and basketball tonight. 
First, the annual pre-season game between the Los Angeles Lakers and Sacramento Kings at MGM Grand Garden Arena. Fans of both California teams have invaded the Strip en masse today for the three-point sports action. 
Kobe Bryant will be the main man to watch for the Lakers, while for Sacramento it will be DeMarcus Cousins tapped as the best center in the league today. 
Early in this pre-season, DeMarcus, with Rudy Gay and Rajon Rondo, have won three of their first four exhibition games. (Incidentally, the trio partied at Marquee in the Cosmopolitan to the sounds of DJ Vice on Monday night.) 
So far in their first three matchups, the Lakers have failed to win, so expect plenty of intense rivalry between the two California cities. 
They shouldn’t go to the game on an empty stomach, so I suggest they eat first when MLB icon Pete Rose hosts the grand opening of his Pete Rose Bar & Grill tonight, a 9,000-square-foot restaurant on the Strip across from Aria and CityCenter. 
The eatery will be open daily for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Developed by HIG Management corporate executive chef Brian Littlejohn, the menu features specials that are a love letter to the three cities where Pete played: Cincinnati chili on spaghetti for the Cincinnati Reds; a classic Philly cheese steak for the Philadelphia Phillies; and poutine for the Montreal Expos. 
Pete, who now calls Las Vegas home, told me in advance of the opening in a Q+A posted Oct. 2, “I love sports, sports fans and great quality food, and this allows me to bring all three together in the perfect location.” Jennifer Romas in Sexxy 
200 SHOWS: Time flies when you’re dancing up a storm and stripping off your clothes! This weekend, producer and choreographer Jennifer Romas will celebrate the 200th show of “Sexxy” at Westgate Las Vegas. 
Her new YouTube video shot and edited by Scott Santos is a sizzler. Launch slideshow » 
NEW HOME: Hollywood rumors abound that our Planet Hollywood resident headliner Britney Spears has paid $7.4 million for a five-bedroom, seven-bathroom mansion set on 21 acres in Thousand Oaks, Calif. 
The hilltop estate has its own tennis court, infinity pool and three-hole golf course. Additionally, she’ll pay $1,836 each month in HOA dues. 
STORK ARRIVAL: Las Vegas supermodel Chrissy Teigen, who jets here to be with her family monthly, is expecting her first child with singer husband John Legend. Launch slideshow » 
The 29-year-old Norwegian and Thai beauty sent out an Instagram photo of themselves this morning captioned: “John and I are so happy to announce that we are pregnant :).” Congratulations from all their friends here at Vegas DeLuxe. 
DEATH ESCAPE: Las Vegas escape artist and illusionist Spencer Horsman finally conquered the death-defying Houdini water torture cell escape to promote the return of Criss Angel ’s “The Supernaturalists” to Foxwoods Resort Casino in Connecticut. Criss, who hosted the stunt Monday, was going to yank the dangerous act from his show if Spencer failed a third time. Launch slideshow » 
Spencer had to be rescued from a water-filled Plexiglas coffin twice before when he failed to unlocks chains and padlocks and was rushed to a hospital. Spencer was suspended 75 feet high by crane for the stunt, which took him four minutes to complete. Criss and his cast of magicians return to Foxwoods from Nov. 11-15 and Dec. 16-20. 
CHARITABLE CAUSE: Circus Couture ’s “Twelve,” a celebration of performance, art and fashion, raised a record amount of $192,000 in its sixth-anniversary performance at the Joint in the Hard Rock Hotel. Nearly 2,000 guests attended. 
The money raised benefits Children’s Specialty Center of Nevada, the state’s only nonprofit, specialized outpatient clinic that treats children with cancer who have good insurance, bad insurance and no insurance. “It’s an amazing thing to know the families we support in the fight could feel the love and passion this colorful community has for their kids,” said co-founder Erica Linz. Launch slideshow » 
PUCK’S PRESENTATION: In advance of his visit Saturday for a cooking demonstration at Macy’s in Downtown Summerlin and a meet-and-greet at his nearby Wolfgang Puck Bar & Brill, star chef Wolfgang Puck ’s Las Vegas team has presented our beloved charity Keep Memory Alive with a donation of $25,000 raised during Wolf’s Sip & Savor dine-around event last month at Spago in the Forum Shops of Caesars Palace. 
BULLY PREVENTION: The National Bullying Prevention Center has created Together Against Bullying inspired by Luxor comedy headliner Carrot Top. TAG is a campaign to help prevent bullying and support the more than 13 million American students who are bullied each year. Carrot Top will help kick off the campaign by tagging his celebrity friends and posting videos on social media encouraging others to get involved and donate. 
“I have made a career out of being different, but it hasn’t always been easy. I have had to deal with bullying throughout my entire life,” said Carrot Top. “This is an incredibly personal cause and something that affects almost every one of us. I want to encourage everyone to get involved.” 
STAR SURVEILLANCE 
Actor Channing Tatum attended Mat Franco ’s magic show at the Linq Hotel on Monday night. 
“CNN Tonight” anchor Don Lemon and former Mayor Oscar Goodman cruised up Las Vegas Boulevard in a 1968 Mustang during a driving tour and interview Monday. The interview is part of CNN’s coverage of tonight’s Democratic Presidential Debate at Wynn Las Vegas. 
Hip-hop artist ASAP Ferg partied with friends to the sounds of DJ Treo at Marquee Dayclub. 
TONIGHT’S TIPS 
Pete Rose opens his Pete Rose Bar & Grill in Hawaiian Marketplace. 
It’s Lakers vs. Kings at MGM Grand Garden Arena. 
Former NBA star Rick Fox scores DJ duties at Hyde Bellagio for Lost Angels Industry night. 
“Alice — Steampunk Concert Fantasy” debuts at Brooklyn Bowl in the Linq Promenade. 
Graham Elwood, Darryl Wright and Sandro Iocolano headline at the Improv in Harrah’s through Sunday. 
TOMORROW’S TEASE 
Our Counter Intelligence report on restaurant openings, and guest columnist chef Johnny Church on opening his Artisanal Foods, plus a front-line kitchen report with Pete Rose. 
Robin Leach of “Lifestyles of the Rich & Famous” fame has been a journalist for more than 50 years and has spent the past 15 years giving readers the inside scoop on Las Vegas, the world’s premier platinum playground.

Follow Las Vegas Sun Entertainment + Luxury Senior Editor Don Chareunsy on Twitter at Twitter.com/VDLXEditorDon . MGM Grand Hotel and Casino 
MGM Grand, a AAA Four Diamond resort, offers 5,044 rooms and suites. 
MGM Grand features KÀ by Cirque du Soleil; Brad Garrett’s Comedy Club; and world-class entertainment at the Grand Garden Arena and Hollywood Theatre. 
The resort offers signature restaurants by celebrity chefs including Tom Colicchio’s Craftsteak, Emeril Lagasse’s New Orleans Fish House, Wolfgang Puck’s Bar & Grill and Michelin three star and Forbes Five Star restaurant, Joël Robuchon. 
As part of its ongoing “Grand Renovation,” MGM Grand has remodeled all rooms and suites in its main tower and is adding several new experiences to its lineup including Hakkasan Las Vegas Restaurant and Nightclub, a new upscale dining/nightlife concept (coming in April 2013). 
MGM Grand also features a state-of-the-art, non-smoking conference center, the Grand Spa, Cristophe Salon, "CSI: The Experience" and an inviting pool complex featuring the tantalizing daylife of Wet Republic. 
Upscale accommodations include The Mansion, an exclusive hotel within the hotel; the luxurious two-story SKYLOFTS at MGM Grand; and The Signature at MGM Grand, a luxury all-suite, non-gaming hotel located adjacent to the main resort. 3799 Las Vegas Boulevard S. Las Vegas , NV 89109 702-891-1111 MGM Grand Garden Arena The MGM Grand Garden Arena is home to concerts, championship boxing and premier sporting and special events. The Arena offers comfortable seating for as many as 16,800 people with excellent lines of sight and state-of-the-art acoustics, lighting and sound.
